instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165A: What is 820-00165A? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D7701: What is D7701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.LP8550: What is LP8550? This is an LED driver responsible for creating the backlight on the LCD screen of Macbooks from 2011 through 2015.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR: What is PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR? This is the input that comes from the charger..
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Damaged Doesn't start with i/o board plugged in
threads.message:
Got a Macbook Air <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> liquid damage job in today <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board. Have cleaned it up and fixed the following issues:
1) <CAPACITOR>C7136</CAPACITOR> completely exploded and burned <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR</SIGNAL> to ground inside the board - have done some digging around where <CAPACITOR>C7136</CAPACITOR> was and cleared this short
2) Backlight feedback to <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> was broken next to L7701/<DIODE>D7701</DIODE>- have repaired this with a jumper wire. 

The issue is board will start fine without the left i/o board connected, it runs gives backlight etc. If the left i/o board is connected I get the orange light and it wont start - tried with known good i/o board, known good connecting cable and known good battery - it wont start at all. 

If I were to connect the Left I/O Board after the fan starts to spin after applying power from charger with battery connected I just get the display with the battery charging symbol then it powers back off and no reaction to power button - power button is working normally when left i/o board isn't connected. 

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is giving 8.6V as I would expect when the orange light is lit. 

I know these boards wont normally start without the battery being plugged in so I'm thinking maybe this is an issue with the battery circuit.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Damaged Doesn't start with i/o board plugged in
threads.message:
"I know these boards wont normally start without the battery being plugged in"
I never faced with such issue on these boards.

Check basic signal for power on sequence with LIO board connected.
Inspect J9500 pins for corrosion.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Damaged Doesn't start with i/o board plugged in
threads.message:
Interesting you should say that - for the past couple years i've never found an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A which will start without the battery when the left i/o board is attached - they will start when the i/o board is not connected usually just like this one!
J9500 is clean - there was 0 liquid damage on that part of the board, main areas of liquid damage were around the display connector and around where the trackpad plugs in - <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> area.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Damaged Doesn't start with i/o board plugged in
threads.message: Are you using original Magsafe 2 charger???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid Damaged Doesn't start with i/o board plugged in
threads.message:
Thats a good question - i'm not 100% sure it is original but it certainly looks it - it's an 85W one. 

Found out why it wasn't starting eventually - it was <RESISTOR>R5501</RESISTOR> not connected on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> side. Now i've got another issue that the board appears to start but after I shut it down and leave it for a bit it won't start up again and gives the "I need charging" symbol (on battery) or the "charging" symbol on the screen (on charger) - battery is at 100%. If I do an SMC reset it'll usually then start up and shows the battery at 100%. I've got a battery on order to test so i'll report back if that fixes it.
